name: Visual Inspection of RMU Location setout
Benchmark established as a dataum for levels
Alignment with approved drawings and site plan
All testing and measuring equipment calibration certificates valid
Free from vegetation, debris, and obstructions
Review of Concrete, and Reinforcement steel
Compliance with IFC Drawings, Specifications and Standards
All reinforcing bars shall be deformed grade 300 to AS/NZS 4671
All concrete construction shall be in accordance with NZS3109
Geogrid and Bidim to minimum Class B
Concrete strength shall be a minimum of 25MPa
Delivery Dockets supplied for each delivery/Pour
Material test certificates supplied for reinforcing steel
Test Method: Visual inspection and photos
Timing/Frequency: Visual Inspection of the foundation
○ No organic or unsuitable material is present
○ Foundation is at the correct level
○ Photos and dimensional check that the construction and RL's comply with the IFC Drawings
○ Minimum of 200mm of compacted Gap40 over Geogrid and Bidim
○ Test the foundation layers strength with a Clegg Hammer
Timing/Frequency: 4x sets of Clegg Hammer tests and measurements to determine the compaction of foundation layers
○ Visual Inspection and photos of compacted aggregate and tests
○ Thickness of Gap40 shall be 200mm over bidim and geogrid as directed
○ Clegg hammer tests shall meet a minimum CIV of 24 on the 4th blow for each test
○ Steel Reinforcing shall comply with NZS3109
○ Concrete formwork construction shall comply with NZS3104 & 3109
Test Method: Visual and dimensional check that the construction and minimum cover required complies with the IFC Drawings & Specifications and Standards
○ Formwork shall be free of warps, bends or kinks, and the tolerances of the top surface of the form shall ensure compliance with the finished floor tolerances of +/- 10mm

○ Reinforcing materials - hooks, bends, bars and surface condition of reinforcement, spacing and fixing, splices, cover and placing tolerances shall comply with NZS3109 unless modified in the IFC drawings
○ Prepour Inspection completed and filled in
Test Method: Visual inspection, photos and dimensional check that any embedments comply with the IFC Drawings
Timing/Frequency: When installed and prior to pouring
○ Embeded items are installed to meet expected outcomes against the IFC drawings
○ Noted in the Prepour Inspection ITC
Timing/Frequency: Prior to and for each pour
○ Concrete baching plant is certified to batch concrete under NZS3104
Test Method: Visual Inspection during pouring
Acceptance Criteria: Proper compaction of poured concrete, no segregatation or honey combing
Relevant Specification: Tests taken in accordance with NZS3112.2
○ Slump Tests are prior to pouring
○ Compression testing shall be at 7, 14 & 28 days post pouring
○ Slump shall be 100 & Compression testing shall be a minimum of 25MPa at 28 days post pouring
Relevant Specification: IFC Drawings NZS3104 & NZS3109
○ Curing concrete shall remain damp during the curing period
○ Slump Tests are prior to pouring
○ Compression testing shall be a set of 3 cylinders taken from freshly batched concrete and tested in accordance with NZS3112
○ Slump shall be 100 & Compression testing shall be a minimum of 25MPa at 28 days post pouring
Test Method: Visual Inspection of surface for cracks, voids, and finish quality
Acceptance Criteria: No visible defects or honeycombing for each foundation post striking of formwork
Comprehensive inspection of all elements relating to the concrete foundations
Compliance with IFC drawings and specifications
Verify concrete foundations meet design and functional requirements from the IFC drawings to what was constructed
Concrete Foundations ready for subsequent construction activities
Each Non-Conformance Reported, Rectified & Closed Out
Development of Punchlist with Client and Contractor Representative
Punch List closed out in a timely mannor
On completion of the concrete foundations:
○ Submission of all test results, ITC's and any as-built drawings
